type.name: section
type.title: Short title.
type.context: MINERALS ACT under Short title. 1.  This Act may be cited as the Minerals Act.
type.description: This Act may be cited as the Minerals Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Regulation of extraction and marketing of minerals.
type.context: MINERALS ACT under Regulation of extraction and marketing of minerals. 2.  No person shall extract any mineral or shall prepare or manufacture for market any article or thing therefrom or shall market any such mineral or any such article or thing except in accordance with the law relating thereto, including any regulations made under this Act.
type.description: No person shall extract any mineral or shall prepare or manufacture for market any article or thing therefrom or shall market any such mineral or any such article or thing except in accordance with the law relating thereto, including any regulations made under this Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Power to make regulations.
type.context: MINERALS ACT under Power to make regulations. 3. (1) The  Minister  may  make  regulations  for  the  following purposes  (a)      the orderly extraction of any mineral;  (b)      the orderly production of any article or thing prepared or manufactured LAWS OF GUYANA 4 Cap. 65:07 Minerals   L.R.O. 1/2012                            Specific provisions in relation to regulations.   for market from any mineral; and  (c)    the orderly marketing of any mineral or of any article or thing   prepared  or  manufactured  for  market  from  any mineral.  (2) The Minister responsible for finance may make regulations for the purpose of providing for the imposition of any tax, duty, rate, cess or other impost in respect of any mineral or in respect of any such extraction, production or marketing as is specified in subsection (1).  (3) Save as otherwise provided in subsection (4) regulations made under this Act shall be subject to negative resolution.  (4) Regulations made under subsection (2) and regulations referred to in section 4(2) shall be subject to affirmative resolution.
